page.title: 09NEWTON HALL WILDLIFE (2)
page.content: There are a few areas of wild flowers alongside the railway and the old railway road to Brasside.There are examples of- SANDWORT,SHEPHERD'S PURSE,WILD RADISH,STITCHWORT,WOOD SORREL,CHICKWEED,FOOL'S PARSLEY,COW PARSLEY,DAISIES,BUTTERCUP,CLOVER,POPPY ,FOXGLOVE,HAGWEED,SAXIFRAGE,RAGGED ROBIN,BIRDFORT,varieties of VETCH and BUTTERCUP.Two interesting flowers can be found in the stream near the old quarry-the Common Spotted ORCHID and the Fragrant ORCHID.On the perimeter of the estate there is a variety of animal.At AMOS' FARM there is a Badger Set.Fox,Stoat,Weasel,Rabbit and Deer can be found in the woods.In the gardens Field Mice,the occasional Rat, Moles and Hedgehogs are in evidence.In the summer Pipestrelle Bats fly around the estate.
